str2: From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).
From dialogizomai; discussion, i.e. consideration, or debate.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To uncover, bring to light, reveal. From apo and kalupto; to take off the cover, i.e. Disclose.
A sword, scimitar; fig: war, piercing grief. Probably of foreign origin; a sabre, i.e. A long and broad cutlass.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pass through, spread (as a report). From dia and erchomai; to traverse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
